Dense¶

class layers.Dense.Dense(input_size, output_size, activation=None)[source]¶

Implements a fully connected (dense) neural network layer.

A dense layer performs a linear transformation on the input data according to the equation Y = XW + b. It is a fundamental building block for most neural networks.

w¶

The weight matrix of the layer.

Type:

np.ndarray

b¶

The bias vector of the layer.

Type:

np.ndarray

params¶

A list containing the layer’s trainable parameters, [w, b].

Type:

list

activation¶

The activation layer to be applied after the linear transformation.

Type:

Layer, optional

backward(output_gradient)[source]¶

Performs the backward pass (backpropagation) through the layer.

Calculates the gradients of the loss with respect to the layer’s inputs, weights, and biases.

Parameters:

output_gradient (np.ndarray) – The gradient of the loss with respect to the output of this layer.

Returns:

A tuple containing:

  • The gradient of the loss with respect to the layer’s input.

  • A list containing the gradients for the weights and biases.

Return type:

tuple[np.ndarray, list]

forward(input_data)[source]¶

Performs the forward pass of the layer.

Parameters:

input_data (np.ndarray) – The input data with shape (batch_size, input_size).

Returns:

The output from the layer with shape (batch_size, output_size).

Return type:

np.ndarray
